name: 1.1.1 - Concurrently Productive üêª[Release candidate 1]
body:
Bugs:
- Settings Schema wasn't modeled correctly `server:port` type was String as well as `onlinePolling:seconds` (+default)

Changes:
- Increases test coverage (settings API)
- Resolves package constraints with multiple vulnerabilities

## What's Changed
* Update dependency @nestjs/schematics to v8.0.7 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/205
* Update dependency vue-cli-plugin-vuetify to v2.4.6 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/206
* Update dependency typeorm to v0.2.44 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/208
* Update dependency luxon to v2.3.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/207
* Update dependency @types/ws to v8.5.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/209
* Update luxon package by @davidzwa in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/210
* Update dependency sass to v1.49.9 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/212
* Update dependency @types/ws to v8.5.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/213
* Update actions/setup-node action to v3 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/214
* Update dependency eslint to v8.10.0 by @renovate in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/165
* Tests api printer by @davidzwa in https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/pull/216


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/fdm-monster/fdm-monster/compare/v1.1.0-rc1...v1.1.1-rc1

name: 1.1.0 - Beastly Productive üêª
body:
Features:
- Adds ability to create printer groups in setting using a new modal
- Auto-clean of aged gcode files at boot or before uploading a file (configurable for different days of age as you wish)

Bugs:
- Fixes a bug when not being able to persist printer name changes
- Fixes bug in auto-clean before upload - filter did not perform file age check properly

Developer improvements:
- Fix test coverage to pick up coverage results

name: Release 1.0.0 - Awesome Monster üêæ
body: The FDM Monster server is ready to be used for printing on many 3D Printers at the same time. Please visit the discord for more information, or feel free to add an issue or discussion in case of tips/questions!

name: Improved upload messages, package updates and user management
body:
Client 0.1.15

## What's Changed
* Basic user management (API) by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/66
* Start updating outdated packages by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/67
* Prettier on vue files by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/68
* Fix upload bars and split from info messages by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/69


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/compare/0.0.4-pre1...v0.0.4-pre2

name: Improved group management & backend role-based authorization
body:
## Prerelease
This prerelease is another step towards a 0.1 version of 3D Hub. Test coverage has been increased to 66% which is getting very close to the goal of 80%!

### Added authorization and OctoPrint API Key security
User roles and permissions have been added in the backend. All API endpoints have been protected against unauthorized use. Also the OctoPrint API keys are not exposed automatically anymore! Much safer to use.

### Group management
We now have the ability to manage printer groups in the frontend website. A missing feature is to be able to create groups and set their location in the Printer Grid. Coming asap

### Packages updated
Important packages like `awilix` or `mongoose` got a major version update with slight breaking changes. All tests indicate green.

### Job history
Tracking printer jobs in the past is really important. We've now got the History Store which is a simplified and generic version of the previous History Cache. The main change is that the database will automatically be adjusted and is the source of truth instead of the cache being the truth (design choice). This pattern has shown to be beneficial in the Printer and FileStore!

## What's Changed
* Close nav after visiting OctoPrint by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/49
* Lay groundwork for editing printer groups by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/50
* Lay groundwork for user with roles by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/51
* Increase test coverage - tasks, services and host by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/52
* Remove current operations cache - useless cache by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/53
* Cleanup and prepare auth middleware for rbauth by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/54
* Prerelease fixes, client release and multi-arch docker build by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/55
* Update packages, use throttle message to send heartbeat to OP and other small fixes by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/56
* Cover server update service and clean the legacy code up by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/57
* Purge history controller, service and rename HistoryCache to HistoryStore by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/58
* Start testing history API by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/59
* Cover printer API by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/60
* Add helmet by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/61
* Bump validator from 13.6.0 to 13.7.0 in /client-vue by @dependabot in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/62
* Expose OP API key with operator or admin role only for printer update by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/63
* Add ability to clear printer from group by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/64
* Release client 0.1.13 for server 0.0.4-pre1 by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/65


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/compare/v0.0.3-pre2...0.0.4-pre1

name: New name 3D Hub and database failure resilience
body:
This prerelease version of 3D Hub introduces support for failing database connections. In the next prerelease v0.0.3-pre3 this will be supported by the Vue frontend as well.

Furthermore we've got some bugfixes and a huge amount of cleanup of unused models/API increasing test coverage to 50%+ ü•≥ 

## What's Changed
* Feature/database resilience middleware by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/41
* Chore/filament spool profiles purgery by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/42
* Chore - rebranding and slight history cache rework by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/43
* Add group management page by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/44
* Add current jobs to printer jobs menu on navbar by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/45
* Bugfix printer enabled in update form by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/46
* File nav ordering wrong - selected file on top - progress bar tiles by @davidzwa in https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/pull/47


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/3d-hub/3d-hub/compare/v0.0.3-pre1...v0.0.3-pre2

name: Cleanup and test coverage, update Docker to Node 16 Bullseye
body:
Pushes client `0.1.8` and server `0.0.3-pre1`

- Remove RoomData, FarmStats (HeatMap) and related caches/services/controllers and models 
  - these are not in the design spec of 3D Hub where this happens client side
  - simplified dashboard statistics cache
- Remove filtering sorting - not scalable nor useful
- Remove unused constants
- Removed `category`, `type`, `ip`, `port`, `octoPrintVersion` and `klipperFirmwareVersion` from Printer model 
  - unused or not in design spec
- Remove amialive controller 
  - merged with app controller
  - sse will serve as liveness detection
- Update to Node 16 on Debian Bullseye
  
Testing:
- Created functions for easy test printer and alert construction
- Tested Alert API (CRUD tests) and script test
- Avoid clearing printers in Printer Controller tests - this avoids race conditions in the same test file
- Added mock for OctoPrint API on top of Axios Mock (and registered for API tests by default)
- Add Printer File API coverage of 75%

## What's Changed
* Chore/cleanup unused api, service, cache and models - test Alert API by @davidzwa in https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/pull/36
* Start mocking OP API for Printer File coverage by @davidzwa in https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/pull/37
* Add test coverage shield by @davidzwa in https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/pull/38
* Chore/release script ps7 by @davidzwa in https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/pull/39
* Small bug in multer service - file uploads folder didnt exist by @davidzwa in https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/pull/40


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/davidzwa/3d-print-farm/compare/v0.0.2-pre4...v0.0.3-pre1

name: Countdown and bugfixes
body:
Adds:
- Countdown to local 4PM, 5PM and 6PM
- Tooltip to delete file button

Fixes:
- Selected files cleared after any drag n drop upload
- Mark selected and printing file in sidenav
- Disable PWA mode  


Pushes client `0.1.7` and server `0.0.2-pre4`

name: Multi-printer uploads with progress bar
body:
This prerelease introduces multi-printer file uploads in all drag and drop panels.
It cleans up internals for interacting with sidenavs and dialogs

Makes the use of the drag and drop file upload even easier

name: Hotfix prerelease
body:
- Bugfixes in legacy group sync
- Updates in client file navigator
- Client printer state checks (operational, printing) and progress bar for printing

name: Alpha 3D Hub
body:
In this version of 3D Hub we're able to manage our printer farm based on OctoPrint. We can upload files and manage the printer farm state. While adding printers to 3D Hub there's a test button to visualize whether the printer is safe to use or whether connection changes are required.

A website based on Vue 2 and Vuetify makes the developer of FDM capable of supporting user feature requests with high speed and reliability due to backend test coverage.
